A0YdlZQsy4bcfKdIZJg_cg.text: Great service and even better food, very fresh. Plus the cocktails are amazing and pretty large.

eamrr2jquwqOXS1LtgYByw.text: The seafood here is so fresh. Nothing fancy just cooked perfectly. Reminds m of the seafood I used to get in Florida.  If you're looking for fresh no frills food this is the place.

So88biWLCauzEy6Ok_fgEw.text: Try this place!! Conch fritters are better than what you can find in Key West. Fresh fish.

oFoMQHeVJu1AbWVkfpX33g.text: So yummy!!  They have the freshest oysters and clams but were out when we visited Saturday night....that's why they got 4 stars instead of 5!!! They get them in on thursdays.  We had appetizers at the bar: fried oysters, conch fritters, and steamed shrimp.  Appetizer menu great with beer.  Say hi to Michelle the bartender!!!

HOgDE6HKmVdkpRPzlbB6Gg.text: Not impressed!  Service very slow. Food over cooked. Glad we tried it but won't be back.

QpKz-ky9KQGADe-X7g9CQA.text: Not to good was Disappointed seafood is not fresh which I understand stand cuzz we're not near water. So basically just frozen seafood.

6ZAWHQn91ClfENFk58mtkA.text: My wife and I ate there Friday evening. I had the garlic shrimp and it was fantastic. Plenty of shrimp. The Pina Colada was fresh and delicious. The Caribbean rice was good but next time I will skip the island pickles and get the mango salsa. Service was good and restaurant was busy. I look forward to going back. My wife felt mahi mahi was fairly plain and wished she had gotten salsa on it.

BRZY8KhBvKHC7z6kx_6DYA.text: This was our third visit. Just as good. The seafood is fresh and delicious, the service is great, and so is the atmosphere. My husband got lamb shanks, our friends got scallops, and I ordered the fried shrimp, again. My pina colada was very tasty and refreshing. It's now one of our regular spots! Our area needed this non-cookie-cutter establishment. Of course, we will be back.

qKwoyMulHllbGXezoUMzbw.text: What excellent food we had at Island Thyme. Very fresh seafood, staff was great, fun atmosphere and decor. You can eat outside under the umbrellas nice touch. Can't wait to go back..thanks for a great time

photos.caption: Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

uJmrTrokMjXoBEz4VcIGuQ.text: nice place fresh fish but owner/manager treating waitress cursing in front of us customer no that's not right

eAegEt1MXjySkaePs6olyw.text: I got a notice from Yelp that this place was open and thought my wife and I should go check it out. Our area needs more good seafood choices and I was pleasantly surprised. We both had Mahi and it was delicious. Service was attentive and pleasant. Looks like I have another go to for seafood now. I would recommend you give it a try.

1Xw83elSyXspfzSXHVgu6w.text: Fresh caught, perfectly cajun-grilled wahoo sandwich with mango salsa salad and cold draft beer.  Hell yeah.

3K76Eo8YgSEHmS7pByFrNA.text: Delicious! Everything from the drinks to the dessert and the service was excellent. I had the tuna burger and potato salad as a side, my husband had the shrimp and scallop burger with yucca fries. We shared a slice of key lime pie.  Everything was delicious. We will definitely return. If you haven't been it is a must try for sure. To top off the delicious food the service was excellent, really above and beyond. Drinks-I had the Bimini Breeze and my husband had the Island Pina Colada

mvh4Qyx30Go_zuC6wf-lsQ.text: My daughter found Island Thyme and wanted to try it for her 13th birthday. We couldn't have had a better experience. Aaron was super knowledgeable and everything was fantastic. Visiting Island Thyme reminded us of travels to the Keys and Caribbean. We started with the conch fritters and smoked fish dip. For our entrees we had the shrimp and scallops burger, the cracked lobster sandwich, and a Cajun grouper sandwich. The shrimp and scallops burger was the best of the 3 entrees, but all were fantastic. I also tried a mojito and strawberry mojito, I highly recommend the strawberry mojito.

nuBT1CDXlqvmERg3PqugYQ.text: Wow!!! Best new restaurant by far!! Great friendly staff, West Indies bbq sauce on shrimp was delicious, as well as the conch fritters and scallops, the Caribbean rice so good and of course every dessert was perfect (flour less cake, coconut flan, bread pudding, key lime pie). Oh and mojitos were really good. Everyone loved their food!!

i9OzqCWOo1LffxX3ojLLNA.text: We saw this driving by, came back around and it may be one of my best decisions ever! Very cute and fun inside with a great staff who were all very nice. I started off with a dark and Stormy cocktail that was perfect, with just the right balance of Rum, Crabbies ginger Beer and lime juice. Then we got the Conch fritters, best I have had since Key West. We talked to the owner, seafood is fresh everyday and everything is made fresh in house. Also try the smoked fish dip, heaven on a cracker. Main course I got the cracked conch pounded out nice and thin then fried in a very light batter, no grease at all. Served with a wonderful dipping sauce and peas and rice with your choice of another side. Try the Caribbean pickles, pickled cucumbers with a hint of sweet and heat. My wife got the chicken Roti, huge flakey pastry very flavorful curry mix inside ask for the mango habanero sauce to set it off perfectly. Save room for the Key Lime pie, you won't be sorry!

mkwPSQmYQDuoHj87tl9Vqw.text: This was a great find! The owner Earl is very personable. He's also the chef! Food is fresh and was excellent. Our group tried a little bit of everything and all parties thought their food was great. In the Fountain shopping center off Audrey Kell!

GWD4i0QmKd3wJpo-89n0BQ.text: My wife and I really enjoyed some of the freshest seafood in South Charlotte.  Conch appetizer was great.  The garlic thyme grouper as well as the cajun triple tail were both fresh and well prepared.  Home made key lime pie was fantastic.  Ambiance was fun, very relaxing, A+ to the staff who were all very responsive.  We will definitely be back soon, with many of our friends.

9QKGlkD35vH3yNlhdcHa5Q.text: Best seafood in South Charlotte. Great "beachy" themed restaurant. Bartender made delicious strawberry mojitos!

zV8TcJZqe-_Dfdj21RIGFg.text: They are a bit disorganized.  Expect a minimum 10 minute wait - just for someone to acknowledge your presence.  Even then, you'll have to physically put yourself in front of the host at the front as no one will make eye contact.  It's a 30 minute minimum wait from that point.   They are new, so it's likely that things will improve.  For now, either go at off peak times or just wait until the newness wears off.  Don't wait too long, though, as no eatery has lasted more than a year or two in that location!

Ug4TicUJ6x1QOP0MiruuPA.text: This is a fairly new restaurant in the neighborhood and we've been here for lunch or dinner probably 3 or 4 times now with our 2 yr old. Always such wonderful food and excellent service that it remains on the top of our list of places to eat out when we want to stay close. They're also super good with our son. It's not always easy to find places with a great atmosphere that are family friendly but these folks are genuinely nice and welcoming. I keep forgetting to take pictures of my food but I will next time because of course, we'll be back! Try the Island Style Bites and a Bimini Breeze!

CdbcsJkHq9AXqKd-WvB4Mw.text: Came here today for 1st time! Met Michelle with two Ls who was welcoming and knowledgeable about the food.  We had the snapper with garlic butter which was delicious!  Everything is cooked fresh and I can't wait to come back and try something new.  Give this place a try!  If you love seafood prepared well, this is the spot!

wnlks49N-15U2pa18nFKYw.text: My wife and I were excited by the prospect of (finally!) fresh seafood close to home. We may try again, but were underwhelmed on our first visit. We both had the mahi platter (Cajun for me and grilled for her) and while we both liked the rice, slaw and cook of the fish, the bland seasoning left something to be desired. The grilled preparation was heavy on the garlic and light on much else, while my Cajun preparation was dry on the outside and short on both heat and savory. Lots of potential here. Hope it's realized.

BPc4NJvGRPPmTMWGP-DTHQ.text: Excellent experience. I had BBQ Shrimp and  chicken tenders unlike any I had ever had. Others had Grouper sandwich and Roti. Local owner who is clearly passionate about the experience. Highly recommend.

3Sa-1CyG9s1mYOvD_NFQ_w.text: Came in on 11/24 for first time. Will be back for sure. Everything was fresh. All prepared perfectly. Michelle at bar did a wonderful job explaining menu. Friendly atmosphere.

IzQlG6zDbtUc23pE3tBY9A.text: I want this place to make it and thrive as I love the idea of fresh fish (not farm raised!) however I feel they will need to tweak the sides menu (haven't been very impressed with any of the sides we've tried.... slaw, potato salad, etc.) and price points to make it work.   If you are going to have upper price points for both entrees AND wine/drinks, you are going to limit repeat visits. We aren't going to be regulars for weekly/weekday dinner with $23 fish/two sides plate and $9+ glass of wine.  Again, the fish has been great! But I do wish they would work on side options and rethink wine price points.  Casual fresh fish price point around here by should be around $16-$19.

iEnOdls6Bx6NFP24kJwhbQ.text: Finally. Great fresh seafood at reasonable prices. Have eaten here three times now... I smile after each visit... and no, I am not the owner, but a customer who moved from Boca Raton and has missed fresh seafood. Keep up the great work.

eNFZG1DwXCt9ZKj2mxpfcw.text: Tried this new place after seeing that a friend had enjoyed a meal here.  I am glad that they explain that this is a place not to go to if you are in a hurry or likes things exactly perfect or just so.  The server started us off with a little background of the chef/owners, food and their service.  Great expectations with just laid back environment tasty seafood including conch ceviche, sides, desserts (some of the best key lime pie and bread pudding we have ever have), normal portions, and overall experience.  Keep it up!

vGYKjp2GZsqDi_ND7Gb98w.text: We recommend as a fresh catch, casual, restaurant, just opened May 2018. Think Jimmy Buffet Florida concept as a local restaurant without the boats out back.  You immediately notice ALL the people here are friendly and happy.  Not a put on just nice to the customers and each other (makes you realize how other places operate differently).  You won't have a dozen choices for fish, maybe 4-5 but you will find something you like. Serve clams, oysters, conch too.   Truly fresh fish, did the grilled (several other options Blackened, fried, garlic butter, etc)  (Hog Snapper fresh catch this night) it was cooked & seasoned perfectly as a platter ($26ish) vs with a sandwich or salad.  Had the Pikliz cabbage salad as an optional side was warned it would be hot, it was, wasn't my thing but tried it.  Would have liked a little bigger portion.  Rice with snapper was flavored mildly good not great.   My wife had the Hog Snapper sandwich ($16ish) and really enjoyed it.    Talking to staff after dinner, this is truly a labor of love and they are striving to give an excellent food experience.  Owner, Earl, told us his priority is quality and consistency over speed.  So sometimes the wait for food may be longer, but he believes it will always be worth it.  Our Fri night wait for food was normal.   They raved about Michelle's desert but just too full.  We will return!

CZ8gd2aWohDznHzoKdmlTQ.text: Good: the fish is fresh and friendly service. Critique: Let me first say this review is coming from a person from the Caribbean. That is, the food is fine in general but naming dishes after Caribbean cuisine may set a bar too high. The conch fritters are fine but if you've had conch fritter made by someone from the islands then there they fall short. The jerk chicken again is fine as a spicy chicken dish but I'm Jamaican so I'd caution someone expecting Jamaican jerk chicken to calibrate their expectations.  The pickliz wasn't pickliz...my Haitian husband confirmed. My recommendation:  hire a consultant specializing in authentic Caribbean cuisine for certain dishes.

OKKqnWTikHY3h6Dn5ROhKw.text: My husband is from South Florida and heard they serve cracked conch, so naturally we had to check it out. Casual, beach vibe off the bat but very clean and nice. We got conch fritters and cracked conch, the fritters were great, but the cracked conch was out of this world. We have had cracked conch in Florida, Bahamas, and Turks & Caicos and this was spectacular.   They fly in sea food fresh daily and that is no False advertisement. From the conch appetizers to grilled Mahi entree with rice and mango salsa it was the freshest ingredients I have enjoyed at a restaurant in a long time, and for an incredibly fair price.   Incredibly friendly service, very obviously family owned. Our waitress shared it's owned by a husband and wife and he is the chef and she makes all of the desserts from scratch. From incredible food to supporting a family business this is a must!

vvByw25DpDAZYEmiFJQ54w.text: Just happened to pop in for dinner and a wonderful surprise!  Had the yellowfin tuna with garlic and thyme sauce, rice and collards.  Fabulous!  Service was very good,  nice beer selection,  the whole place has a fun vibe.  Will be back soon!

pgv0XhUJcDGnoHPWGy7S2w.text: Very good new restaurant. Staff is very polite and the seafood is fresh. Decent priced. Nice bar area. All around good spot.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pickles
Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Cajun
Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wine list

t03A53lgzGEqyz-MFRjE2Q.text: Good Food, must try.  Stopped by for lunch to the most pleasant spot.  Fresh seafood, good island flavors, and wonderful owners.  Everyone was so friendly and welcoming.  The food was delicious. Sides were really good, we had rice( a must have), potato salad, yucca fries and regular fries... all very good.  My husband had jerk chicken and I had grilled shrimp, both were very good.  Only complaint was the jerk chicken was fresh or hot( was room temp and had consistency that it was prepared the day before.  Still the flavor was on point.  We will be back, next time I can't wait to try the lamb shank and Caribbean pork.

13q1-NxbDHH91V92fCMCPA.text: First time visiting with my cousin & her son who lived in key west for over 30 years. They both felt like they were back home in Key west. Great food. Great atmosphere. I Highly recommend visiting this place, it may become one of your favorites!

ALhOlr5OjKNV69eJwwzxbA.text: Wonderful food, great service.  Seafood great   Owner cook talked with us about fish comes from.  All flown in, never frozen or farmed.  Prices reasonable

0upXlX5QBUdC6XJtUmsE8Q.text: Went on a recommendation.  Very good.  Conch fritters were excellent.  Split chicken as well.   Had the triple fin fish sandwich.  Nice/fresh, although it needed a little salt.  Will return.

586rS8H5HIFs6R4LO64QWA.text: Went here because my boyfriend had a serious craving for jerk chicken. He was not disappointed in the least. The menu had good variety and the space was decorated to make you feel you were right on the ocean. Service was great, we will go back!

re3u_zYLmVLjQ7lGa1l_Ag.text: Great atmosphere and friendly, knowledgeable staff.  The food is outstanding.  We had the fried Mahi, the Cajun Mahi, and the crab cakes.  They were all excellent.  When the owner learned it was our first visit he swung by to chat.  Consider us regulars now.

Ot3TF61-HQQIXtVpnc-3fQ.text: I found this place a few weeks ago with my son. We have been back 6 times since then. Yes that many. My wife now has tried it and is addicted. The staff are fantastic and the food is as well. Few tips. Ask for the mango hot sauce. Also if you are a bread pudding fan this is absolutely the best I have ever had in my life. I am not exaggerating. The owner is a friendly fellow that often check on tables. You feel like family after a few times. There are not a lot of experiences I have had that rate this high. Closest comparison I can think of is Cajun yard dog but for seafood. I am telling you try this place you won't be disappointed.

XI01uRroDUnrY4pua9w6qA.text: So very pleasantly surprised to find this little gem of a restaurant tucked away in the corner of the shopping center. Terrific ambiance with upbeat music playing but not so loud you have to scream to be heard. Staff so friendly and knowledgeable- the owner came to greet us and ALL the staff pay attention to ALL the tables so service is incredible.  Choose the fresh fish - we had snapper that was a very generous portion, well seasoned and fresh fresh fresh. Big side salad - plenty of food we probably could have shared an entree fish sandwich. Definitely coming back, five big stars.  Owner Earl and Michele are great people!

YLgSiLORG3C1SAJ8tCLM6g.text: This fantastic new restaurant has only been open for a few weeks, and I've already been back four times! The focus is on seafood with fresh fish flown in weekly. The menu features a "Fresh Catch" selection which changes weekly. The fresh catch can be ordered as part of a salad, or on a sandwich, or on a platter with two sides. There are also other items on the menu if seafood isn't your thing, or just not what you want today. Check out the Jerk Chicken!!! "Raw Bar" selections are available along with several starters and sides, and some very good desserts!   From the starter menu, I've had the Conch Fritters and the Conch Chowder - both are excellent! As noted earlier, there are several  sides to choose from, but my favorite is the Caribbean Rice! From the fresh catch list, I've had the Mahi, Swordfish, and Halibut - all excellent! You can select your catch from the availability of the week and then have it prepared how you like it, including blackened, grilled, or fried. Most (if not all) desserts are made in-house, but do yourself a favor and try the bread pudding!  It is no doubt some of the very best bread pudding I've had anywhere!  They also have a full bar with a variety of beer, wine and other liquors.There is also a patio for outside dining.  Chef Earl and his wife Michelle have put a LOT into this new venture and I'm clearly impressed. It is not part of a franchise or a chain. The island "vibe" in the restaurant is very nice and service has been excellent!   This gem is a little hard to find, but they are in the Fountains Shopping Center at the corner of Ardrey Kell Road and Tom Short Road. It is located back in a corner, by the fountain, with colorful umbrellas outside on the patio. KEEP LOOKING, it's worth it!!

ObJ1L8j-tuGRcNyW1fsumA.text: Food is always great and the servers super friendly.  It is great to have a non chain restaurant around, particularly since there are a dearth if seafood places in Charlotte.  This is a casual spot and you can even bring the kids.

8Ft2e2dIr0inDzLiIg9jYg.text: A slice of paradise right in Charlotte! My husband and I ordered the mahi fresh catch which was light, buttery and all around delicious. But what we really need to talk about are the yucca fries - UNREAL! We felt like we were truly on an island having a tropical dinner. Wonderful!

qvh6GNs5aZ2L146CXLvt8g.text: If you have ever been to the islands this is a must try.  We had fresh oysters, peel and eat shrimp and the chicken Roti.   All really good( the roti was my favorite) but the best part was our server.  She was so personable and friendly.  We will be back.  Nice to see another restaurant in the fountains that will make it.

LXATDKMJ2NiWNEnBJfCPMw.text: Really awesome experience! Michelle was a great bartender/server sooo attentive. The conch fritters were great and the scallop shrimp burger was no filler ALL shrimp and scallop perfectly seasoned. The yucca fries were excellent with a cilantro garlic sauce. The bread pudding was SOOO GOOD! Fresh out of the oven we were invited back to see the full tray as it came out. Such a great spot that makes you feel so welcome!! The chef and owner also had us try the roti and conch chowder and both were amazing! Can't wait to return.

snOptCS9Y6x2vqG2aFzN9A.text: Great food. Try the clam strips or come in for taco Tuesday. Drinks are also pretty good.

NrdiSdv30-2jY40C6wv0-Q.text: Great clam strips. My husband had the lamb shank which he said was cooked well and the portion was enormous. I had the jerk chicken, very yummy, and the rice. I definitely would NOT get the greens. We would have loved to have tried dessert but the service was so bad the we decided to go elsewhere.

KHYtDhY5namx75w1_CkROQ.text: Extremely fresh seafood. We had the conch fritters, grilled calamari, and blackened grouper salad with ginger dressing. I wouldn't change a thing. Forgot to take a picture of the salad, because I was too busy eating.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled calamari
Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Conch fritters

8BYWMMsImd1O1X9w0_Qx8w.text: This place is awesome. I truly love the variety the flavors and the regional cuisine's that you don't get in most Caribbean restaurants. The prices are a little high but I have a feeling the rent is high where they're located. Go, take a friend introduced them to something wonderful from the Caribbean.

6pVtlbNlI2cUvi-OrcWdmg.text: This is a unique restaurant that serves GREAT  seafood in an Caribbean   atmosphere !!! Love it!!!

6bPYg1wv_qYYI9nqWlXGIQ.text: What a wonderful place. The ambience and decor give you a feeling of being on vacation in the Caribbean and not in a suburb of Charlotte. The menu has a wide variety of items for every palate and the bar staff is very knowledgeable and attentive. This is our new go to place.

2NtdtSZcDsdsnEKYxcz64A.text: Great fresh seafood & Homer & Shelly are very friendly bartenders.  I get oysters at the bar quite often and the staff treats you like good friends.  I highly recommend the place.  The owner, Earnest is very hands on and cares about your experience.

VBofrbdYbq_4byWnCR3AZQ.text: I had the grouper with mango "salsa". I hope the chef responds and tells me otherwise, but the salsa tastes like it was made with canned fruit. It reminded me of a can of cocktail fruit that is syrupy. Here's a great salsa recipe for you with fresh ingredients which are plentiful around here.   3 ripe mangos - diced  1/2 cup fresh diced fresh pineapple 1 chopped red pepper 1/2 small chopped red onion 1or 2 minced jalapeno w/seeds for heat 1/4 cup chopped cilantro Juice of 1/2 lime  The fish was cooked ok. I was just really disappointed with the salsa and lack of fresh ingredients.

72T-e3nxHuYh-VXPo9Lh6Q.text: I guess you could call us Island Thyme regulars since we've eaten there no less than once per week for the last couple of months.   We've tried almost everything on the menu and have not been disappointed.    Some of our favorite appetizers include conch fritters, fried oysters, smoked fish dip and island-style bites.    We've tried all of the fresh catch specials, preferring that they be simply grilled so we can enjoy the flavors of fresh fish.   And the fish is fresh, not frozen.  If the  oyster roll is on the menu, I'm ordering it!    Wonderful roll loaded with perfectly fried oysters!   Earl, the owner and chef, knows how to prepare fantastic seafood!  Our favorite sides are the Key West slaw, potato salad, and the sweet mango salsa, as mango salsa should be.  We're usually too full to eat desert there, so we often take it home to enjoy later.   All are made from scratch by Michelle and are simply amazing!  We've eaten them all.  Sometimes we sit at a table, but we also like to sit at the bar so we can talk to our favorite bar tender, Michelle.  She makes awesome drinks and is just a really fun person.  We've taken friends and family there and all agree that Island Thyme is the real deal when it comes to fresh, flavorful food, great service, and a really fun atmosphere.

nF9bDmSaEX-FPNakcWz2sg.text: Amazing selection of seafood that you can't find anywhere else - wahoo, hog snapper, triple tail, swordfish, conch, etc. (check for daily selection).  It's all cooked to your liking and to perfection.  Their jerk chicken is as good as I remember from Jamaica and beats anything else around.  Also ask about their "you hook 'em, we cook 'em" offering.  The laid back island environment and family feel is refreshing, with a friendly staff that is ready to take care of you on your voyage with them.

kNsIFbZkQ4JXiev6EzlKzQ.text: In support of a locally owned, non-franchise restaurant we tried out Island Thyme.   The location is well hidden, not easily seen from main road and is hampered by the Landlord ban on overt advertising and outdoor entertainment. Unfortunately since The Irish pub was let go from this location many years ago, several ventures have failed.   Inside the decor and music carry an Caribbean theme, and are pleasantly welcoming. It is good to see the bar from O'Shea's still in use and in fine condition.   We ordered 3 starters and two sides and a desert (baked banana and Icecream- it was awesome). The West Indies BBQ shrimp, smoke fish dip and shrimp BRUSCHETTA.   Though I thought the price of the food items was a little high, the quality and taste was very satisfying and clean and flavourful. I will return to try other items on the menu.   Also order a pina colada, which lacked coconut and any rum flavour. Next time I will try the local Charlotte breweries beer.

wUsBNXdo8e4qBACW6LeAog.text: A real taste of the South as I grew up from South Florida! Fresh fish specials daily. We had the Mahi Mahi and Wahoo specials. Both were delicious! Their garlic butter sauce is amazing! Also had steamed clams that were so fresh!  Caribbean rice is good and loved they offered seaweed salad as a side! Owners were super nice and friendly as well as wait staff. Will defiantly be back! Belongs on the water. Hope it stays authentic and doesn't change to cater to locals here like a lot of restaurants here.

Kz609ounLq0FgYIjKYU_tg.text: I started with a bloody Mary and it was bloody good. -Conch fritters: LOVED THEM! - but ask for the hot sauces, I mixed a bit of Jamaican and Peri sauces with the ketchup it came with, that worked perfectly.   4 stars -Smoked fish dip: fresh tasting but very bland, boring. 2 stars -Caesar salad: looked like one but didn't taste anything like it, sweet rather than tangy. The wife liked it, I didn't.  3 stars -West Indies BBQ shrimp, again sweet. Nice taste, I expected stronger flavors, not impressed by their size (40/lb?)  3 stars -1/2 Jerk chicken, not well marinated nor nicely roasted either. The skin was pale, the flesh pinkish and the jerk was slathered on top. The worst part was the rice which came with it, it was cooked to death and mushy, frankly disgusting.  2 stars for the chicken, negative for the rice. The service was pleasant, but there was no mistaking this place for Key West.

SNh2s0gj4SV4DUFn4Fsg0g.text: This place is AMAZING! We had the scallop&shrimp burger and it was so fresh and all seafood. Their shrimp was sooo good. The seafood portions are so generous and it's pure seafood, so fresh. The atmosphere is just like being on the island. Our waiter Josh was awesome, his recommendation were on point and he was so good. Will be back for sure!!

fND72Kc_cf1L8tuc7he40w.text: It's my first time at this secret  hideaway. I tried the blackened grouper & it was very fresh & not frozen, seasoned to perfection & delicious to taste!! My hubby had the bbq shrimp platter. The shrimp was fresh also. The rice & peas were a little under seasoned but very tasteful if ur having a blackened fish because it bring balance.  Well...dessert was a hard decision but we decided upon Keylime Pie & Bread Pudding. The keylime pie was a great combo of sweet & tart. The Bread pudding was very tasteful. It needs extra sauce because the bread absorbs the sauce quickly. I recommend this place & we shall return again.

9YgvvHmMHwNChM0pCPE2fg.text: First time and will definitely be back. Great to have some variety in the area. We had Jerk Chicken, Mahi-mahi. Everything was excellent. Fresh, great seasoning, and authentic Jamaican fair. The Island Pickles are a must side. The baked bananas are also a good bet.  The service is just fine. If your in a rush this is not the best choice. The name "Island Time" should be your first clue. This is a place to have a relaxing time with friends - which we did.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

q-fpjWWPB8bEIeld5lh-ng.text: Cute atmosphere in Blakeney area storefront-umbrella tables to eat outside but in here lies the problem. Huge fly population-they can't help that but,  it was a definite downer. Maybe fans or smoking tiki's to go with the theme.   The service was good and the food average to good. We started out with the smoked fish dip and followed it with the crab cake and the tuna sandwiches.

CM9mejRGAwYEX9r4DNqEpA.text: I am not an avid review writer for YELP. But, whenever I travel a fair amount and I do use YELP. If I have great food or great service, I enjoy writing a complimentary review. This is the first time I have written a negative review on YELP.   I took my wife and children(ages 16,18 and 23) to dinner to celebrate my 52nd birthday. It was my idea to try Island Thyme based on a 4/5 YELP rating. For background, my wife and I are from Louisiana, and we know good food, and we know good seafood. South Louisiana has a French to Caribbean feel to a lot of the cuisine. We use rice in numerous dishes. I have travel to the Caribbean a dozen times or more and eaten authentic Caribbean food as well. Island Thyme is not on point.   The hostess was nice, stating that they are not a franchise, they are from South Florida and bring in all their seafood fresh from South Florida. It sounds great! But, the food tasted pre-frozen to me and my entire family.   I had the Triple Tail with Caribbean Rice and Yucca Fries. My wife had the Shrimp Platter and my daughter had the Crab Cake Platter. The Yucca fries were all the exact same size and shape(suspicious). The fries were crispy on the outside, but not soft on the inside, like fresh cut Yucca fries usually are. They were a bit chewy. I don't know if they were pre-cut/pre-frozen fries, but they presented that way. The rice had a musky taste, almost like burnt oil. My wife's rice tasted the same. My daughter's crab cake tasted like the crab cakes you can buy frozen from an number of grocery stores. The Triple Tail had a bit of a "fishy" taste to it. I literally sprinkled it with Tabasco to get 1/2 of it down. We were all really trying to make this work, after all it was my birthday and we are a pretty positive bunch. But, finally we just had to admit that this was awful food.   In short, if they are using fresh fish and fresh Yucca, it did not taste like fresh. The service was great, the staff was cheerful, the decor was cool. But, we came for fresh Caribbean food and Island Thyme did not deliver.

TOwuNoFLia9prjJAKaW9SA.text: Did not enjoy the food. The name is misleading. We thought we were about to eat some good Caribbean food. Instead the food lacked in flavor tremendously. The service wasn't great either. It seemed that the servers lacked experience.

S17ae918-U-tWzshgaYihw.text: We have been there twice. Each time wonderful  food, minimal to no wait, good service. Love love love ... swordfish bites, fried shrimp platter ... Big shrimp! And fish spread. We are hooked.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Perfect place for a Birthday Dinner

VKD9sexciGrhQZvtr5-TFA.text: Eh. I'm not impressed. I'm alright with overpriced food if it's good quality (see my Yama review). I just thought this was overpriced, small portions and nothing special. I'll try again in a few months because we live so close.

hmAjaehyffcimLyBvTegaQ.text: STOP WHAT YOU'RE DOING AND GO HERE NOW!   This restaurant is everything. Everything (well food-wise) I've missed about my home town in South Florida, summer trips to the Keys & Bahamas.   This is a small family-owned and operated business and they really have something here.   I honestly can say that this place is on par with food I've eaten in the Caribbean, if not better!   You can't even get cracked conch in the keys...but here it is in Charlotte! What was once a special island vacation treat is now 10 min from my house and it is FRESH!   Speaking of fresh, EVERYTHING was super fresh as this fine establishment actually makes daily trips to pick up their shipment from the airport!   They have excellent, friendly staff with a fun Florida style atmosphere. Really reminds me of home.   I can't say enough good things about them. Go give it a try!

g4exczDJyf_W8nVDkKRu5w.text: Great new seafood place in South Charlotte. Locally owned and delicious! Had the grouper done Cajun & garlic thyme and it was brilliant. Half price glasses of wine on Sundays so Suzi was happy! BBQ shrimp appetizer was outstanding. .... .....

APiJwiMozP1_goyi0wWK-A.text: I'm going to stray from the norm here since I'm a bit torn as to how to write this review.  Simply, I liked the place i.e. decor, service, friendliness of the staff etc.....I thought the food could use some work. Went on a Saturday afternoon for lunch as we were passing by and Sweetie LOVES a fish sandwich.   Nice young man greets us and made some recommendations.  The menu was nicely done and they had a "fresh catch" menu which was a nice touch. I decided on the Hog Swordfish which I know is a hot commodity this time of year.  You can have it fixed a few ways, I chose cajun or blackened on a salad.  With the salad I think he said they have house made dressings so I went with soy ginger.  The salad came out and it was "OK".  The lettuce was HUGE, big leafy greens which needed to be chopped before they get put in the bowl.  The soy ginger? Flavorless.  As I have learned from watching years of Gordon Ramsey shows, you have to taste it before you send it out.  If someone had, it would have been jazzed up.  The fish?  It was cooked well, plump and juicy and the fish itself was very flavorful.  The blackening spice?  Flavorless.  I just tasted the fish and it was completely void of any blackened flavor.  It looked like it had plenty of seasoning, but it the flavor flashed off.   All that said, I like the concept.  Fresh, cooked to order seafood and some meat options.  Sandwiches, plates, and good friendly service.  I'll go back and try the food once again.

YvRGiwQq6xwd_X1tcQO3Pw.text: So this is tough for us...in the beginning when they first opened, we LOVED it. Service, food, drinks, etc. We always got the fresh catch and veggies and a lovely dessert. The couple who own it are always there anf so fun and chatty.  BUT recently it has gone downhill on the food front. We went with a party of 3 a few weeks ago and ALL of our fish was overcooked and they messed up two of the orders. Its surprising given the menu is fairly straightforward too.  plus the prices seem to be getting more steep. the fish dish is now $25. I am not sure this will remain on our staple list...

7NXEdF8zgKo3MtadMaMpfQ.text: We hooked 'em and they cooked 'em. My husband and uncle went deep sea fishing and this cute place cooked them up for us.   Charming little spot in Charlotte with a Key West vibe. Great staff and excellent food. Family friendly environment with a cute little patio. We will absolutely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

BE8uWVJ9N3GeJHJleuJseQ.text: Extremely disappointing experience. When we arrived we tried to sit at the bar and the bartender which we later found out was a manager told us we would not be able to order food. We decided to stay and sat a table, when we expressed our concern for how our experience was when we arrived the other manager on duty seemed to care less and never once said she was sorry and told us "she could not control what he says." I would not recommend this restaurant and will NEVER return. We just asked to speak to the manager again and we have been waiting for 20 minutes so we decided to not dine here and left.

CSnRFBG4wcAP9Y6rZTA1IA.text: What a lovely first visit. Josh was an awesome waiter!! We had the fried oysters, cracked conch and the shrimp bruschetta. The oysters were huge and yummy. We enjoyed the cracked conch, but the shrimp bruschetta was FABULOUS. We loved the unique flavors of it. The bread was nicely grilled, and the curry/garlic/cilantro/tomato/capers combo was spot on!! We will be back!

drZIwy7f8YtsjaPOq8UGNA.text: We come here every week! My family has a bunch of favorites: cracked conch is delicious, mahi tacos on Tuesdays, grouper salad, love the coleslaw and smoked fish appetizer. And Michelle's key lime pie is seriously perfect.   You can dress up or come as you are after work or play. They just welcome you right on in. It's really a happy place to be and it's refreshing to find such fresh, well prepared seafood in a casual and relaxed environment.

r3x9viwbjuyEUhDqVRM51A.text: South Charlotte, particularly the Ballantyne area, has few neighborhood, non-franchises to get excited about, well...this IS one. Serving up fresh fish daily on sandwiches, salads or in a combination with two sides in a casual environment that Jimmy Buffett would undoubtedly approve, this joint gets a lot of things right! Starting with the fresh fish (and ending with the house made desserts.)   The 25 minute wait time that our excellent waiter, Aaron, informed us about in advance was worth it (well, amost). I went with the grilled grouper salad with ginger dressing. It was perfectly prepared. The only real shortcoming was that, at $17.95, the tomatoes should have at least been bought at a local farmer's market. They are just too plentiful in our area for that not to be the case.   My wife went with these grilled pumpkin swordfish at $23.95 and two sides, the collard greens and mango salsa. The collards were a little spicy and the salsa was a little on the sweet side, but again, the fish was perfectly prepared.  We closed things out with an ample sized slice Michelle's Key Lime Pie for $5.95. It was very tart but pleasantly so. Overall, it was a good experience, the place had a 94.5 sanitary rating, the service was excellent and I'd say they're off to a good start.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Festive outside seating.
Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Michelle&#39;s Key Lime Pie.
Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Grilled Pink Swordfish.

6g59fm6yJpA9dZUYbsppyg.text: When leaving DB's one night, I drove by this place and basically screamed at my husband HOW HAVE WE NOT SEEN THIS JIMMY BUFFET BAR. So naturally we took my parents and some friends here while they were visiting. The atmosphere, service, and food were superb. Everyone loved their cocktails and I was very pregnant and ordered the Jamaican grapefruit soda, it was amazing! I ordered the grilled salmon on a salad and everyone loved their food. I can't wait to come back and get a tropical cocktail of my own!

rsO24qvd2f8eyx-6qyRaSA.text: We went on a Friday night for dinner. The hostess and server were very welcoming and friendly. As we walked past the bar to be seated, the bartender very loudly cursed while looking at a drink order. Nobody seemed to care. We looked at the menu and noticed that sandwiches don't come with a side. If you want fries or anything else, it's extra. Not the end of the world, but seemed unusual to us. We ordered and the food came out in reasonable time. To be honest, the food was fine. Nothing special, but nothing terrible. However, while we were eating, the owner walked over to the window that opens to the kitchen and began yelling and berating the cook. Very loudly. The entire restaurant could hear him. It was really awkward. So, our food experience was OK. The rest of the experience was not that great. I don't think we will return.

aip0mFJoX96hrN4PKWXs4w.text: Everything was fresh and tasty!  Don't skip dessert.

Y-g8YKJz115S3xqtDdgrAA.text: I am giving this restaurant 3 stars for a specific reason. The food, waitstaff and atmosphere rank a 4 to 5 in my opinion. However, I had to leave my lunch early, because of a loud argument between the manager/owner and two of his staff members.   Personally, I don't really care what the staff members did incorrectly. But, this man used profanity and I could hear him precisely. This was incredibly uncomfortable. We tried to get the attention of the man, but his back was turned to us. His employees stood and listened to him for the entire monologue. I'm hoping that this was a one-off and that the owner was having a bad day. I did stop to speak with the employees on the way out, who all apologized to us. Imagine getting yelled at by your boss and then apologizing to the customers. It made me sad for them. Yet, they didn't say a word about him. They just smiled. They're better folks than I could have been under that same circumstance. They could have told the owner that I was leaving, but it's not up to them. How would you go about telling your own boss that someone's leaving because of their actions? The staff was amazing.  I have worked in restaurants, I understand the stress. My first impulse was to call the restaurant and speak with the owner. But, I felt it would just end there. I'd like folks to go to this restaurant to just make sure it stays a friendly environment for everyone. They have a good thing going, I'd hate for them to get a reputation.   If the owner reads this: I love a locally-owned restaurant. Your employees are the number one reason for success. They cook the food, if they're talented and happy, then you're going to do well. There will be difficulties, but you need to keep your calm.   The food was excellent. Our waiter was so much fun: Josh. That guy has a ton of personality, and he was efficient and attentive. The atmosphere, and decor are super cool. I'd love to see what it would be like on a weekend night. I bet it's packed. The menu had price ranges from $8  - $ 23, so there's something for everyone. The food was excellent. Please take the above comments as constructive criticism. I did enjoy my meal. At home.

gm9DF2vIIoB5X0pJgWve-Q.text: My girlfriends and I decided the try a new restaurant. Once we arrived we were told that they were out of several things. However we decided to still wait and try out the place.  I order a the fresh catch that tasted like grouper & red snapper. I was delicious with the right amount of seasoning on the fish. However the down fall The Caribbean rice was out and the cabbage mix was not for me. I didn't know it was going to be cold and  a strong vinegar taste. I substituted the fries and those were great.

jqP1BjjdaIsMDnJkTpSo2g.text: Was slow at lunch time on a Friday, so nice and relaxed. The food was very high quality! The staff and owner super friendly. We had the hardest time ordering because the menu had too many amazing sounding dishes. We ended up with 2 starters and to amazing salads! We'll definitely be back.

hESedhEKvz6_uPCMcySJgg.text: Was in the mood to try something new and different for lunch on Sunday, so decided to check out what was new on Yelp and that is where I came across a place called "Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub".  Hmmm, I thought, how timely, given that I will be heading to the Caribbean next week, and one of my most favorite things about traveling there is the amazing food I get to sample on the islands.  Given the fact that the place noted on their website that they are locally and family owned, I considered that a huge plus as I am always looking to support original places, as while I am not anti-franchise, I enjoy the variety and diversity that local original concepts offer, especially here in South Charlotte where that can be lacking at times.  In terms of location, you really have to be looking for it to find it, as it is located in the back section of the Fountains at Ardrey Kell.  The actual location is in the spot that I personally consider the Bermuda Triangle of restaurants as I am pretty sure that 4 or 5 other places have failed to last more than a year or two in this very same spot.  Outside, the decor definitely tries to give off that island vibe as all the expected accompaniments can be found including porch chairs, colorful signage and even a tropical feel cornhole set which is a nice touch.  Plenty of outdoor seating is available, but no awnings at present to keep the sun out of your eyes, so probably best to choose inside unless you are dining later in the evening, although I should point out that they close at 7pm on Sundays and at 10pm during the week and on the weekends, which is disappointing considering they have a full bar and could potentially be a fun spot to have a few drinks on a Friday or Saturday night.  Started off with a Pina Colada which was not good at all as it was very heavy on the pineapple juice to the point of being orange in color.  No coconut flavor at all even after I pointed out that the drink was very heavy on the juice.  Menu says it is made with rum, cream of coconut and pineapple juice, but unfortunately it tasted like an $8 dollar glass of Dole, so was very disappointed especially considering the "island theme" of the restaurant.  Strawberry Mojito was similarly disappointing as it tasted more of Strawberry juice/syrup than anything else, although I do give them credit for the use of fresh mint, as many places these days seem to think that Mint is an optional ingredient in Mojitos, so kudos for not skimping on the mint.  Again however, for $8, it is disappointing to have a drink taste like fruit juice as even the mint couldn't save this one.  As far as the food goes, some hits and some misses...    The jerk chicken was very good with an authentic Jamaican jerk flavor and nice spice level throughout, so definitely a nice job there in terms of overall presentation.    The Yucca fries on the other hand were not good at all, as they were too reliant on breading instead of letting the natural flavor shine through.  Yucca is a very underrated side in my opinion as it has some health benefits and a great flavor, but lathering on the breading makes it just like any other "fry" in my opinion.  I think the Yucca would be much better served in it's natural state vs the breaded and fried route, as the wonderful flavor of Yucca is enough to stand out on it's own without a bunch of breading.  The Crab Cake Sandwich had an abundance of crab meat inside which was a pleasant surprise as far too often, places rely on a large amount of filler, but no so here, so nice job in that respect.  Unfortunately, again the breading is the culprit, as the heavy reliance on Panko breading actually takes away from the flavor of the crab meat and takes the sandwich down a notch, whereas if a different lighter type of breading were used, this sandwich could have really stood out as the crab meat tasted very fresh.  The West Indies BBQ Shrimp was served in a sauce that the server described as sweet with some heat, but unfortunately the sauce was underwhelming to say the least, but the shrimp were very fresh and juicy, as I could tell that they take their commitment to fresh seafood seriously, which will definitely serve them well moving forward.    Overall, as much as I want to support local establishments, I also am aware that there are way too many other options out there to just give a place a pass simply because they are not a franchise.  The drinks were not good at all and the food was ok, but at the price points charged, weren't really a great value, although the jerk chicken was very good and worth giving a try if you have never experienced it before.  I would probably be willing to give it another shot, but wouldn't go out of my way as we have so many restaurants here in South Charlotte that a new place really needs to differentiate itself more than just in name only to get added to the rotation.  With all that said, I really hope they succeed as variety is the spice of life.

ikdYVaa1jNPfw-N9PkvbSw.text: Another good experience w/ my family. Captain has yet to disappoint w/ the fried conch, conch fritters, collards, rice n' peas.

photos.caption: Photo of Island Thyme - A Calypso Grill & Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp Bruschetta

97wvsc-N6oFpDOijdjx12g.text: Delicious, fresh seafood, flown in daily.  Met the owner and he obviously takes a lot of pride in serving excellent seafood.   The fried conch was amazing and the batter is light and tasty.  Even the desserts are all made in house and delicious.  And they also had fried plantains as a side; haven't had those since visiting S. Florida.   Definitely the best seafood I've had since moving from Florida. .

ynMGyD6iWhen8hkxvH3c3A.text: Just wasn't my cup of tea. Tried the crab cake burger, oysters and chicken bites. Was not impressed and pretty sure we got food poisoning from the oysters. Waitress was really annoying too and would not leave us alone, repeatedly coming to the table asking us questions pushing other menu items

tUhqtMM52CkggKZr1--xWA.text: What a hidden gem!!! Delicious cocktails, seafood, and desserts in a cozy, fun, and friendly atmosphere. It felt like we were on a beach vacation!  We waited for a table for about 15-20 minutes on a Friday evening around 6pm and enjoyed expertly made tiki drinks (the Painkiller was especially good) while we waited at the bar.  For dinner we had conch fritters and the mahi-mahi platter (prepared with Cajun seasoning), with sides of rice, fries, and collard greens. All was amazing, and we would definitely order this again. For dessert we had key lime pie and the banana cake brownie -- both made in house and wonderful.  The service was perfect, and all the staff were very friendly. We can't wait to return!

MWpF3Cm0ypfKlZuSSiiRVQ.text: Recommend patio seating. Table immediately in front of the patio door gets the brunt of the fan. So, if that isn't your thing - steer clear and ask for a different table. Fun atmosphere and excellent, good quality food - fresh and from scratch. Party of 4 and every one of us really enjoyed our choices. For those in the party that are non seafood eaters, options are a little more limited than usual. Be sure and check the menu ahead of time. This was our first time there and we'll definitely be going back. Hostess stand is inside and indoor waiting space is tight. When people are waiting, it makes it tough to get through. There is plenty of waiting space outside though.   Definitely check them out!
